type: Environmental Factor
description: Air currents are movements of air in the atmosphere, affecting the distribution and movement of clouds. name: Humidity
type: Environmental Factor
description: Humidity is the amount of water vapor present in the air, influencing cloud formation. name: Clouds
type: Natural Phenomenon
description: Clouds are visible masses of water droplets or ice crystals suspended in the atmosphere, formed through various processes involving temperature, humidity, and air currents. name: Temperature
type: Environmental Factor
description: Temperature is a measure of heat or cold in an environment, affecting the rate of condensation and evaporation. relation: Clouds --[Formed By]-> Warming of Earth"s Surface--description:Cloud formation begins with the warming of the Earth"s surface, which causes warm air to rise and cool.-- relation: Clouds --[Formed By]-> Air Currents--description:Air currents play a significant role in cloud formation by lifting warm, moist air and causing it to cool.-- relation: Clouds --[Associated With]-> Dew Point--description:When the air reaches its dew point, clouds begin to form as water vapor condenses.-- relation: Clouds --[Formed By]-> Temperature--description:Clouds form when warm air rises and cools, leading to the condensation of water vapor.-- name: Dew Point
type: Meteorological Concept
description: The dew point is the temperature at which water vapor in the air begins to condense into liquid water. name: Cirrus Clouds
type: Cloud Type
description: High, wispy clouds composed of ice crystals, often seen in the sky on clear days. name: High Altitudes
type: Atmospheric Layer
description: The upper part of the atmosphere where conditions are very cold and dry. name: mare"s tails
type: Cloud Formation
description: Mare"s tails are high-altitude clouds that have a wispy, hair-like appearance. relation: mare"s tails --[Formed In]-> High Altitudes--description:Mare"s tails form at high altitudes where the air is very cold and dry.-- name: Stratus Clouds
type: Cloud Type
description: Low-lying clouds that form in a more uniform layer across the sky, often gray and can bring overcast skies and light rain. name: water droplets
type: Substance
description: Tiny liquid water particles formed through the process of condensation.
